commentary_on_process: To solve the problem, I subtracted the market share percentage of Apple in Q1 2014 from the market share percentage of Apple in Q4 2014, which gave me the percentage point increase. I could have solved the problem better by also considering the shipment volumes of Samsung and Apple in Q1 2014 and Q4 2014, as this would have given me a more complete picture of the smartphone market during that time period.
problem_text:
Context:
In 2011, Samsung had the highest shipment market share worldwide, followed by Apple. In 2013, Samsung had 31.3% market share, a slight increase from 30.3% in 2012, while Apple was at 15.3%, a decrease from 18.7% in 2012. Huawei, LG and Lenovo were at about 5% each, significantly better than 2012 figures, while others had about 40%, the same as the previous years figure. Only Apple lost market share, although their shipment volume still increased by 12.9 percent; the rest had significant increases in shipment volumes of 36 to 92 percent. In Q1 2014, Samsung had a 31% share and Apple had 16%. In Q4 2014, Apple had a 20.4% share and Samsung had 19.9%. In Q2 2016, Samsung had a 22.3% share and Apple had 12.9%. In Q1 2017, IDC reported that Samsung was first placed, with 80 million units, followed by Apple with 50.8 million, Huawei with 34.6 million, Oppo with 25.5 million and Vivo with 22.7 million.

Question:
How many percentage points had Apple share increased from Q1 in 2014 to Q4 in 2014

steps.step_response: We know the market share percentages of Samsung and Apple in Q1 2014 and Q4 2014, but we don't know their exact shipment volumes. We also know that Apple lost market share in 2013 but increased its shipment volume by 12.9 percent.

steps.step_response:
The market share percentage of Apple in Q1 2014 was 16%, and in Q4 2014 it was 20.4%. To calculate the percentage point increase, we subtract the Q1 2014 percentage from the Q4 2014 percentage: 

20.4% - 16% = 4.4%

Therefore, Apple's market share percentage increased by 4.4 percentage points from Q1 2014 to Q4 2014.
